articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: JPMorgan undercuts discount brokerages on trades
articles.description: JPMorgan Chase & Co, in a bid to lure customers from the discount brokerage industry, said on Tuesday it will begin offering free stock trades for self-managed accounts through its Chase mobile banking app starting next week.

articles.author: Elias Glenn
articles.title: China says won't resort to strong stimulus but will keep liquidity ample
articles.description: China's central bank said on Tuesday that it will not resort to strong stimulus to support the slowing economy but will keep liquidity reasonably ample and offer more help to companies which are having trouble obtaining financing.

articles.author: Daren Butler
articles.title: Trump vows 'no concessions', Turkey's lira stays under pressure
articles.description: The lira weakened against the dollar on Tuesday after U.S. President Donald Trump said he would give Turkey no concessions in return for the release of a detained American pastor, the latest salvo in a worsening rift between the NATO allies.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Beijing to act against 'hidden' local debt: China Daily
articles.description: China has drawn up new guidelines on measuring and controlling "hidden" local government debt, the official China Daily said on Tuesday, citing senior government sources.

articles.author: Andrew MacAskill
articles.title: Exclusive: Britain extends lead as king of currencies despite Brexit vote
articles.description: Britain has extended its lead in the global currency trading business in the two years since it voted to leave the European Union, in another sign London is likely to continue to be one of the world's top two financial centres even after Brexit.

articles.author: Engen Tham
articles.title: China banks set for modest profit growth as bad loan outlook under cloud
articles.description: China's biggest listed state-owned lenders are expected to post modestly higher profits and steady margins for the six months ended June, as government efforts to boost spending and liquidity underpins loan growth.

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.title: U.S. Federal Reserve's solo act faces tremors in Turkey and a slower Europe
articles.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve, deep into a cycle of rate hikes it hopes to continue into 2020, now faces emerging risks from abroad that could short-circuit its plans.

articles.author: Makiko Yamazaki
articles.title: Japan's Daikin, thriving in Asia and India, sets sights on Africa
articles.description: Daikin Industries, the world's largest maker of air conditioning equipment, is turning to Africa for further expansion, 10 years after a successful gamble on sharing its key technology with a Chinese company.

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.title: U.S. appeals court revives case against CBS over pre-1972 recordings
articles.description: A federal appeals court on Monday revived a lawsuit accusing CBS Corp and CBS Radio of copyright infringement for playing digitally remastered songs recorded before 1972 by Al Green, the Everly Brothers, Jackie Wilson and others on radio stations and online.

articles.author: Gwladys Fouche
articles.title: Norway wealth fund allowed to stay on as investor if Tesla goes private
articles.description: Rules governing Norway's $1 trillion wealth fund would allow it to stay on as an investor in Tesla if the electric carmaker goes private, its deputy CEO said on Tuesday.

articles.author: Abhinav Ramnarayan
articles.title: Market ructions to delay Greece's post-bailout bond sale
articles.description: Greece celebrated the end of eight years of bailouts on Monday, but expectations that it will mark its new-found fiscal independence with a much-anticipated bond sale next month may be dashed as wider tensions play out.

articles.author: Noel Randewich
articles.title: The bull that won't die: S&P 500 back at a record after months on ice
articles.description: After a seven-month stall, Wall Street's bull market looks back on track, thanks to Amazon.com , Alphabet and other high-flying technology and consumer discretionary companies.

articles.author: Noel Randewich
articles.title: The bull that will not die: S&P 500 back at a record after months on ice
articles.description: After a seven-month stall, Wall Street's bull market looks back on track, thanks to Amazon.com Inc , Alphabet Inc and other high-flying technology and consumer discretionary companies.

articles.author: Lisa Barrington
articles.title: Lebanese chafe as economic blues begin to bite
articles.description: For Mazen Rahhal, a shopowner in a bustling district of Beirut, Lebanon's economy has seldom felt more precarious. In one store, he sells clothes at a fraction of their previous price. Another, which he rented to a rival business, now lies empty.

articles.title: Fresh Brexit referendum could spark civil unrest, warns shadow trade secretary
articles.description: Shadow trade secretary Barry Gardiner voiced fears that people would lose faith in the ballot box and turn to the extreme right if the 2016 result was not honoured.

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/DailyMail
articles.title: Britain will become a '21st century exporting superpower' after Brexit
articles.description: Official figures released in June showed exports hit a record £620billion last year. This comes as the accounting for 30 per cent of that was from UK GDP.

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/DailyMail
articles.title: S&P 500 touches all-time high and ties record length for bull market
articles.description: The market's benchmark index eked out a slight gain, closing on Tuesday a little below the high mark it set in January. The rally pushed the Russell 2000 index of smaller-company stocks to a record high.

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/DailyMail
articles.title: 'We must stand together to deal with aggressive and malign Putin':
articles.description: He will  demand fresh sanctions from the EU on 'malign' Moscow amid rebuke to Angela Merkel and Emmanuel Macron. His speech in Washington will urge European and American allies to unite.

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/DailyMail
articles.title: Muslims around the world mark the Eid al-Adha holiday with prayers and slaughtering of cattle
articles.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT. From the US to Russia, Muslims have gathered around the world to mark the Eid al-Adha holiday with prayers and slaughtering of cattle, sheep and goats.

articles.author: CNBC US Source
articles.title: Final Trade: CGC, GLD & more
articles.description: The "Fast Money" traders share their final trades of the day, including Canopy Growth, the GLD, Lennar and HollyFrontier.
